Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert J Felder was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Robert J Felder was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 18 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Continue with AODA treatment, counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 1.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Oconomowoc Police Department to be paid as a condition of probation.
Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either August 19, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence FORTHWITH.  Condition time may be served in Dodge County

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert J Felder in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Count 5 dismissed by operation of law.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statements by the defendant.  

Court orders the following: 

Count 1:
- 3 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 18 days if revoked.
-1 year Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must be verified to Agent.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.  

Count 2:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. STAYED
-1 year Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either August 19, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Fine of $3,776.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Oconomowoc Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
CONDITION TIME: 75 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.  Condition time may be served in Dodge County.

DEFENDANT MUST ALSO POST A $1,000.00 CASH BOND.  Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant only to be released during business hours to have SCRAM installed immediatley upon release.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
